binary.name: rtsnd
binary.syntax: rtsnd [-L logname] [-p pathname] [-if pidname] host port
rtsnd -rpf [-L logname] [-p pathname] [-if pidname] host portname

option.od: print the help message and exit.
print the RST version number and exit.
ignore scan flag and process all data (usually sounding mode data is indicated by a scan flag of -2).
process data from a specific channel number for stereo mode data.
log connections and information in the file logname. By default, connections are recorded in snd.rt.log.
store the 2-hour files in the directory pathname.
record the process Identifier (PID) of the server in the file pidname. By default, the PID is recorded in snd.rt.pid.
hostname or IP number of the system to connect to.
port number to connect to on the server.
The remote port number is stored in a text file.
filename of the text file containing the remote port number.

synopsis.p: Creates 2-hour snd format files from a fitacf TCP/IP data stream.

description.p: Creates 2-hour snd format files from a fitacf TCP/IP data stream.
The data is written to a file called "yyyymmdd.hh.iii.snd" where yyyy is the year, mm is the month, dd is the day, hh is the hour, and iii is the radar identifier code.

example.description: Generates snd files from the host "kapqnx.jhuapl.edu", served at port 1024. The process identifier is recorded in the file "pid.id", and logs of all transactions are recorded in the file "log.yyyymmdd" where yyyy is the year, mm is the month, and dd is the day.

Generates snd files from the host "kapqnx.jhuapl.edu", served at port contained in the file "port.kap". The process identifier is recorded in the file "pid.id", and logs of all transactions are recorded in the file "log.yyyymmdd" where yyyy is the year, mm is the month, and dd is the day.
